titles.title: Rediscover Your State Resolution of 2002
Expressing the sense of Congress that the people of the United States should be encouraged to rediscover attractions in the States in which they live.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 3/6/2002--Introduced. Rediscover Your State Resolution of 2002 - Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) people should be encouraged to rediscover the attractions, events, and venues in their State and to resume normal activities; (2) increased travel and tourism is needed to help stimulate the economy; (3) people should contribute to their local economies by resuming normal recreational and entertainment activities; and (4) the establishment of special initiatives to encourage tourism at the local level could help revitalize the economy.
